intro: Crambe grossheimii, commonly known as the narrowleaf crambe, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and elongated, with a slightly hairy texture. Crambe grossheimii is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in coastal and rocky habitats.
